quote: Kuolemassa on parempi, taivaassa on parempi olla kuin täällä ihmispetojen keskellä. Täytyy itkeä. Niin, siellä on parempi kuin täällä. Oojah! Paljon parempi.
author: Aleksis Kivi

quote: »Yksin ei ole miehen hyvä olla».
author: Aleksis Kivi

quote: »Työhön kaikin voimin; sillä tämä elämä maksaa tämän vaivan, ja ihmiskunta, näemme, ei olekkaan tuota pahempi vekkuli; ei, vaan onpa, luulen minä, maailma meille niin kuin maailmalle me; ja hän, joka »alati vääryyttä kärsii», hän katsokoon kuinka on laita omassa povessansa.»
author: Aleksis Kivi

quote: Mitä voimme saattaa matkaan tyhjästä?
author: Aleksis Kivi

quote: Raskas oli heidän taakkansa, mutta hauska.
author: Aleksis Kivi

quote: Ahkeruus on onnen lähde
author: Aleksis Kivi

quote: Älä helsingissä!
author: Aleksis Kivi

quote: Ei ole yhtäkään hätää niin kauan kuin työtä ja tointa piisaa maailmassa, vaikka täytyykin kulkea ja jamata talosta taloon ja kylästä kylään työtä ja leipää hakemassa.
author: Aleksis Kivi

quote: 誰も自信が無いのかしら。
author: 太宰 治

quote: 傑作も駄作もありやしません。人がいいと言えば、よくなるし、悪いと言えば、悪くなるんです。
author: 太宰 治

quote: 私たちは、生きていさえすればいいのよ
author: 太宰 治

quote: 未完の美は美ではない。
author: 坂口 安吾

quote:
Arvelee, ajattelevi
miten olla, kuin eleä
pimeässä piilossansa,
asunnossa ahtahassa
kuss' ei konsa kuuta nähnyt
eikä päiveä havainnut.

Ei neittä väellä vieä,
vastoin mieltä miehelähän.
Sille neiti antaminen,
kelle mielensä tekevi.
運命にまかせるよりほかに仕方がないわ。神様なんてこの世にないんですから。
author: 夢野 久作

quote: 私達、これから本当に生きられるだけ生きましょうね……
author: 堀　辰雄

quote: Hän kaipasi ihmis-seuraa, mutta ei tohtinut mennä ulos huoneestaan.
author: L. Onerva

quote: Oliko nainen siis heikompi, huonompi, vähemmän älykäs kuin mies? Ei. Erilainen ainoastaan…
author: L. Onerva

quote: Kenties oli sittenkin niin, että rakkaus oli ikuinen vain sillä ehdolla, että esinettä silloin tällöin muutettiin.
author: L. Onerva

quote: Ainahan nuoret ovat olevinaan viisaat
author: Johan Ludvig Runeberg

quote: Jääkärit neuvottelivat, mutta mitä neuvoteltiin, eivät he itse voineet eikä kukaan muukaan pitkään aikaan käsittää.
author: Johan Ludvig Runeberg

quote: Ihminen on luonteeltaan sosiaalinen eläin, mutta evoluution näkökulmasta vain rajatuissa metsästäjä-keräilijä-heimoissa. Urbaani, ahdas ja monilukuinen yhteiskunta ajaa ihmisen nurkkaan.
author: Tatu Vornanen

quote: Me luomme itsemme sillä, mitä teemme. Puhe on halpaa ja ajattelu ilmaista, mutta teot painavat.
author: Joonas Konstig

quote: Jos et ole itse kokenut epätasa-arvoa, niin se ei tarkoita, etteivätkö muut olisi ja etteikö se olisi todellinen ongelma.
author: Eveliina 'Evelina' Tammenlaakso

quote: Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: Orthodoxy means not thinking - not needing to think.
author: George Orwell

quote: Why should one feel it to be intolerable unless one had some kind of ancestral memory that things had once been different?
author: George Orwell

quote: If there was hope, it must lie in the proles, because only there, in those swarming disregarded masses, eigthy-five per cent of the population of Oceania, could the force to destroy the Party ever be generated.
author: George Orwell

quote: The more men you've had, the more I love you.
author: George Orwell

quote: The consciousness of being at war, and therefore in danger, makes the handing-over of all power to a small caste seem the natural, unavoidable condition of survival.
author: George Orwell

quote: Past events, it is argued, have no objective existence, but survive only in written records and in human memories. The past is whatever the records and the memories agree upon. And since the Party is in full control of all records, and in equally full control of the minds of its members, it follows that the past is whatever the Party chooses to make it.
author: George Orwell

quote: The best books are those that tell you what you know already.
author: George Orwell

quote: No advance in wealth, no softening of manners, no reform or revolution has ever brought human equality a millimeter nearer.
author: George Orwell

quote: If the facts say otherwise, then the facts must be altered.
author: George Orwell

quote: What can you do against the lunatic who is more intelligent than yourself, who gives your argument a fair hearing and then simply persists in his lunacy?
author: George Orwell

quote: Never, for any reason on earth, could you wish for an increase of pain. Of pain you could wish only one thing: that it should stop.
author: George Orwell

quote: Power is not a means; it is an end. One does not establish a dictatorship in order to safeguard a revolution; one makes the revolution in order to establish the dictatorship. The object of persecution is persecution. The object of torture is torture. The object of power is power.
author: George Orwell

quote: The more the Party is powerful, the less it will be tolerant; the weaker the opposition, the tighter the despotism.
author: George Orwell

quote: Merely to be alone, not to be beaten or questioned, to have enough to eat, and to be clean all over, was completely satisfying.
author: George Orwell

quote: If you want to keep a secret you must also hide it from yourself.
author: George Orwell

quote: Be human and sing a song
All you need in order to break the silence is lies
Capture scientists
There is a correlation between immaturity and masculinity
Innovation might not be such a bad idea
You'd have to be insane to need capitalism
Morons imagine cryptocurrencies
Don't surrender to everyone else's jealousy, just skip and jump.
Don't feel sorry about being terrifying
With spectacular sciences come spectacular fires
One day you will be undesired
Civilization without men is surprisingly good

Wake up in the morning.
Be mindful.
Don't ask questions.
Yesterday no longer matters.
Your thoughts can also be dumb
Life is beautiful. Let the future generations cleanse it of all evil, oppression and violence, and enjoy it to the full.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote: Humanitarianism under capitalism is capitalist humanitarianism. This humanitarianism mints gold out of the bones, the blood, the health and the suffering of the whole working class while it sheds tears about an individual case of cruelty to one human being. This humanitarianism punishes murder with death and beats to death the pacifist who protests against war as an act of mass murder.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote: In vain would we begin to seek in our time, anywhere in the world, a regime which, to preserve itself, did not have to recourse to measures of stern mass repression.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote: Who aims at the end cannot reject the means.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote: A victorious war, generally speaking, destroys only an insignificant part of the conquered army, intimidating the remainder and breaking their will.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote: During war all institutions and organs of the State and of public opinion become, directly or indirectly, weapons of warfare. This is particularly true of the Press. No government carrying on a serious war will allow publications to exist on its territory which, openly or indirectly, support the enemy.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote: One learns to ride on horse-back only when sitting on the horse.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote:
If you share your secrets with me gods, I promise to not steal them.
Unless they're fun.
author: Uncle Artie
source: My Catgirl Maid Thinks She Runs the Place (2020)

quote: This computer thing. It's like everything you need in a single box.
author: Uncle Artie
source: My Catgirl Maid Thinks She Runs the Place (2020)

quote: A thought comes when "it" wishes, and not when "I" wish
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: It is nothing more than a moral prejudice that truth is worth more than semblance; it is, in fact, the worst proved supposition in the world.
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: One must do everything ONESELF in order to know something
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: Love to one only is a barbarity, for it is exercised at the expense of all others. Love to God also!
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: One begins to distrust very clever persons when they become embarassed.
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: The will to overcome an emotion, is ultimately only the will of another, or of several other, emotions.
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: Objection, evasion, joyous distrust, and love of irony are signs of health; everything absolute belongs to pathology.
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: Insanity in individuals is something rare - but in groups, parties, nations, and epochs it is the rule.
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: One no longer loves one's knowledge sufficiently after one has communicated it.
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: The premature hypotheses, the fictions, the good stupid will to "belief", and the lack of distrust and patience are first developed - our senses learn late, and never learn completely, to be subtle, reliable, and cautious organs of knowledge.
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: He who relies solely on warlike measures shall be exterminated; he who relies solely on peaceful measures shall perish.
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)

quote: All warfare is based on deception.
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)

quote: The general who wins a battle makes many calculations in his temple ere the battle is fought. The general who loses a battle makes but few calculations beforehand. Thus do many calculations lead to victory, and few calculations to defeat: how much more no calculations at all!
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)

quote: There is no instance of a country having benefited from prolonged warfare.
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)

quote: To fight and conquer in all your battles is not supreme excellence; supreme excellence consists in breaking the enemy's resistance without fighting.
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)

quote: When the enemy has made a plan of attack against us, we must anticipate him by delivering our own attack first.
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)

quote: Though an obstinate fight may be made by a small force, in the end it must be captured by the larger force.
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)

quote: If you know the enemy and know yourself, you need not fear the result of a hundred battles. If you know yourself but not the enemy, for every victory gained you will also suffer a defeat. If you know neither the enemy nor yourself, you will succumb in every battle.
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)

quote: Attack is the secret of defense; defense is the planning of an attack.
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)

quote: Standing on the defensive indicates insufficient strength; attacking, a superabundance of strength.
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)

quote: What the ancients called a clever fighter is one who not only wins, but excels in winning with ease.
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)

quote: You can ensure the safety of your defense if you only hold positions that cannot be attacked.
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)

quote: Do not interfere with an army that is returning home.
author: Lionel Giles
source: Sun Tzu on The Art of War (1910)
